subject: Correction: Call for 2020 IEEE Program Evaluators for Accreditation Activities
body:
The following message is being sent on behalf of the IEEE Educational Activities Board (EAB). This message is being distributed to multiple lists so we apologize for any duplicates. If you are currently an IEEE Program Evaluator you do not need to re-apply, but we encourage you to forward this information to colleagues who may be interested in this opportunity.


The IEEE Educational Activities Board (EAB) is seeking qualified professionals from industry, government and academic sectors to serve as Program Evaluators to assist in accrediting Engineering and Engineering Technology Programs for the Engineering Accreditation Commission (EAC) and the Engineering Technology Accreditation Commission (ETAC) of ABET, Inc. The deadline for submitting an application is 1 November 2019.  

Do you want to contribute to the achievement of high quality educational standards of engineering and engineering technology programs? Do you want to interact directly with students from which future employees will be recruited? Do you want the opportunity to network and interact with fellow program evaluators, faculty members, and institutional executives?  These are just some of the benefits you will experience as an IEEE Program Evaluator.

IEEE Program Evaluator candidates are required for the following ABET-accredited programs:  
  • Computer Engineering and Computer Engineering Technology
  • Electrical Engineering and Electrical and Electronic Engineering Technology

Things to note:
  • This is a strictly volunteer position.  
  • ETAC Applicants must be IEEE Members.
  • EAC Applicants must be IEEE Senior Members.
  • The submission deadline for applications is Friday, 1 November 2019, for the 2020-2021 academic year. Act now to take advantage of this unique opportunity!

For more information: 
  • Applications for both EAC and ETAC are available on the ABET website at https://www.abet.org/program-evaluators/become-a-program-evaluator/
  • General information for prospective applicants can be found at https://www.ieee.org/education/accreditation/pev-opportunities/pev-qualifications.html?utm_source=mga&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=call_for_pevs
  • If you have any specific questions or would like additional information, please contact IEEE Accreditation Program Manager – Regina Samson, at +1 732 562-5306 or r.m.samson@ieee.org

IEEE Region 1: https://www.ieee.org/r1/
IEEE Region 2: https://www.ieee.org/r2/
IEEE Region 3: https://www.ieee.org/r3/
IEEE Region 4: https://www.ieee.org/r4/
IEEE Region 5: https://www.ieee.org/r5/
IEEE Region 6: https://www.ieee.org/r6/


To unsubscribe from all mailings, use your IEEE Account to update your "Communication Preferences"

Unsubscribe from EAB eNotices: Unsubscribe from List

Subscribe to EAB eNotices: Subscribe to List
